dmca.title: [AB-C42386S] Abuse 2200: Irdeto 4.7 FreeCAM patch tool for Windows XP
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern: Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA"). Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim. Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal. Legal Response Team THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC. -----Original Message----- From: abuse@theplanet.com [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] Posted At: Wednesday, June 28, 2006 1:07 PM Posted To: Copyright Conversation: [AB-C42386S] Abuse 2200: Irdeto 4.7 FreeCAM patch tool for Windows XP Subject: [AB-C42386S] Abuse 2200: Irdeto 4.7 FreeCAM patch tool for Windows XP Reference: [AB-C42386S] For your review. Thank you, Policy Enforcement The Planet Internet Services, Inc. http://www.theplanet.com/legal/ ==== Original Message ==== 1. Abuse 2200: Irdeto 4.7 FreeCAM patch tool for Windows XP Added by system at Wednesday, Jun 28 2006 03:17 am X-MailFrom: EBooth@irdeto.com X-RcptTo: abuse@abacus.inside.theplanet.com Received: from [172.16.214.181] by [10.5.0.64] (abacus) for ; Wed Jun 28 03:16:59 2006 Return-path: Delivery-date: Wed, 28 Jun 2006 03:16:58 -0500 Received: from mail.inside.theplanet.com ([172.16.214.110] helo=mail.theplanet.com) by mx02.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from EBooth@irdeto.com) with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim) id 1FvVEI-000NlQ-Na for abuse@abacus.inside.theplanet.com; Wed, 28 Jun 2006 03:16:58 -0500 Received: from mx02.inside.filter.theplanet.com ([172.16.214.181] helo=mx02.filter.theplanet.com) by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from EBooth@irdeto.com) with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim) id 1FvVEH-0002NB-JY for abuse@theplanet.com; Wed, 28 Jun 2006 03:16:57 -0500 Received: from mx3.irdetoaccess.com ([193.173.45.3]) by mx02.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from EBooth@irdeto.com) with esmtp (Exim) id 1FvVEH-000Nkv-5Y for abuse@theplanet.com; Wed, 28 Jun 2006 03:16:57 -0500 Received: from nlhfd.irdetoaccess.intra ([193.173.45.43]) by mx3.irdetoaccess.com with Microsoft SMTPSVC(5.0.2195.6713); Wed, 28 Jun 2006 10:16:56 +0200 X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft Exchange V6.0.6603.0 content-class: urn:content-classes:message MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="----_=_NextPart_001_01C69A8B.3829C759" Subject: Abuse 2200: Irdeto 4.7 FreeCAM patch tool for Windows XP Date: Wed, 28 Jun 2006 10:16:56 +0200 Message-ID: <4012239A2EA9E242BC2985893E76675E03273A7A@NLHFD-XCH063.domain1.intra> X-MS-Has-Attach: X-MS-TNEF-Correlator: Thread-Topic: Abuse 2200: Irdeto 4.7 FreeCAM patch tool for Windows XP Thread-Index: AcaaizfZJJq5QAKDRM2fGjwusstV/w== From: "Esmeralda Booth" To: X-OriginalArrivalTime: 28 Jun 2006 08:16:56.0149 (UTC) FILETIME=[38400850:01C69A8B] Received-SPF: none (mx02.filter.theplanet.com: 193.173.45.3 is neither permitted nor denied by domain of irdeto.com) client-ip=193.173.45.3; envelope-from=EBooth@irdeto.com; helo=mx3.irdetoaccess.com; (multipart/alternative) Multipart prefix (text/plain) This is a multi-part message in MIME format. MIME element (text/plain) Dear Sir/Madam, In searching the Internet, Irdeto Access B.V. has established that the website http://www.dream-pirates.gmc.to/wbb2/thread.php?threadid=2050 ("the Website") infringes its intellectual property rights. Furthermore, the content of the Website is unlawful, based on Clause 4 of the Conditional Access Directive (98/84/EC). Please provide me with the name and contact details of the owner of the Website. Reference is made to the ruling of the Dutch Supreme Court of 25 November 2005 (Lycos/Pessers), in which the Supreme Court ruled that an ISP should co-operate with third parties in retrieving the identity of the operator of a website if the content of such website could be unlawful towards those third parties. I hereby request you to take sufficient action in order to remove the Website from the Internet. I emphasize that an ISP can be held liable for infringing information on websites for which it is responsible. Furthermore, based on article 14 of the European Directive on Electronic Commerce (2000/31/EC) (implemented in the Netherlands in article 6:196C of the Dutch Civil Code) and based on the Digital Millennium Copyright Act (article 512 US Copyright Act), an ISP is obliged to as soon as the ISP obtains actual knowledge of illegal activity or information and is aware of facts or circumstances from which the illegal activity or information is apparent, to act expeditiously to remove or to disable access to the information. Reference is made to the decision of the Court of Appeal of Amsterdam, the Netherlands, dated 7 November 2002 (XS4ALL/Deutsche Bahn). I hereby kindly request you to inform me within 3 days after the receipt of this notice, whether or not you will act expeditiously to remove or to disable access to the information and whether or not you will assist Irdeto Access B.V. in retrieving the identity of the operator of the Website. Yours sincerely, Esmeralda Booth Irdeto Access B.V. Jupiterstraat 42 2132 HD Hoofddorp The Netherlands MIME element (text/html)

Dear Sir/Madam,

In searching the Internet, Irdeto Access B.V. has established that the website htt p://www.dream-pirates.gmc.to/wbb2/thread.php?threadid=2050

 (“the Website”) infringes its intellectual property rights. Furthermore, the content of the Website is unlawful, based on Clause 4 of the Conditional Access Directive (98/84/EC).

Please provide me with the name and contact details of the owner of the Website. Reference is made to the ruling of the Dutch Supreme Court of 25 November 2005 (Lycos/Pessers), in which the Supreme Court ruled that an ISP should co-operate with third parties in retrieving the identity of the operator of a website if the content of such website could be unlawful towards those third parties.

I hereby request you to take sufficient action in order to remove the Website from the Internet. I emphasize that an ISP can be held liable for infringing information on websites for which it is responsible. Furthermore, based on article 14 of the European Directive on Electronic Commerce (2000/31/EC) (implemented in the Netherlands in article 6:196C of the Dutch Civil Code) and based on the Digital Millennium Copyright Act (article 512 US Copyright Act), an ISP is obliged to as soon as the ISP obtains actual knowledge of illegal activity or information and is aware of facts or circumstances from which the illegal activity or information is apparent, to act expeditiously to remove or to disable access to the information. Reference is made to the decision of the Court of Appeal of Amsterdam, the Netherlands, dated 7 November 2002 (XS4ALL/Deutsche Bahn).

I hereby kindly request you to inform me within 3 days after the receipt of this notice, whether or not you will act expeditiously to remove or to disable access to the information and whether or not you will assist Irdeto Access B.V. in retrieving the identity of the operator of the Website.

Yours sincerely,

 

 

Esmeralda Booth
Irdeto Access B.V.
Jupiterstraat 42
2132 HD Hoofddorp
The Netherlands

MIME element (text/plain)
